column4: is there a way to install ubuntu without using the default gui?
no no
I'm talking about when you boot
the install cd
and it gives you the "boot:" prompt.. or something similar
just hitting enter takes you into a weird little sort of gui thing
well, it's like a pseudo-gui
an asciiart-ui
sort of
it flickers uncontrollably
at the boot: prompt hit F1 to F7 to see some options
and I can't get through the install process using it.. is there perhaps an alternative
thanks.. I'll give that a shot
dell sent me a replacement laptop because my old one died (long story), and I'm really trying hard to get ubuntu back on but it's proving to be difficult
in particular there's an option regarding video.. can't remember though, but it might fix the flickerking enough to let you install
thanks! just pressing f1 led me to do "linux debian-installer/framebuffer=false" which worked PERFECTLY!!!
glad it works :D
carbo... I know it might be hard to tell at this point, but when I reboot after the base system is installed... will that setting be saved to install the other packages?
I know it launches back into that text based ui thing
if i remember correctly, whatever options you use to install will be used for booting later on
thanks again!
